isis.stitle: STEERING GENERAL SERVICE INFORMATION AND FRONT WHEEL ALIGNMENT - DRAG LINKS - REMOVE DRAG LINK AND DRAG LINK STEERING ARM ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: REMOVE DRAG LINK AND DRAG LINK STEERING ARM ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove cotter pins and nuts from drag link ends where they fasten onto the drag link steering arm and pitman arm.
Separate drag link from pitman arm and drag link steering arm. Use a removal tool to separate drag link from drag link steering arm.
Remove the drag link steering arm from the knuckle in the same manner as the tie rod steering arm. Refer to TIE ROD.
Remove key from drag link steering arm.

caution.para: Observe the following precautions in regard to the power steering gear when the drag link or steering linkage is disconnected.
A. Do not move the steering gear output shaft by way of the pitman arm when the drag link is disconnected. This may cause air to be introduced into the steering fluid.

B. Do not turn steering gear input shaft more the 1.5 turns from center with the steering linkage disconnected on a TRW steering gear. If turned more than 1.5 turns, it may cause the automatic poppets to reset, affecting end of travel pressure relief.
